text: in this video I'm going to be talking
about how to choose the best ashram for
you before I left to India I knew that I
wanted to stay in an ashram and I wanted
that experience but I had no idea which
one to choose there are so many if you
google ashrams in india there will be so
many that pop up that it is overwhelming
and you don't know where to start you
don't know how much you should be paying
if you should be paying anything at all
so even though i read some blogs from
fellow travelers who have into ash trams
i decided that i would take some of
their advice and check out the ones that
they recommend it but i was going to
wait till i got to india and explored a
little bit on my own before committing
the acronym experience is very different
for each individual so it's important to
choose the right ashram for you so I
would recommend going to India and you
can go to certain areas that have that
are known for for being more spiritual
and offering those awesome experiences
and yoga retreats and meditation
retreats like my sore in the south or
rishikesh hardwired in the north those
are both great places to study and to
stay in an ashram have that experience
so you can do some research on which
which parts of India offer more of these
opportunities and go there and wander
around a bit it's important to go into
these ass ramps and see how you feel and
talk to the teachers and maybe other
students who are there and get their
advice and their their feedback and see
what they offer what's most important is
to see how you feel when you are in the
ashram and when you're looking around
and kind of scoping out the place go
with how you feel if you feel like wow I
have a great feeling about this place I
feel there's something inside of me
that's telling me that this is this is
the place that I want to stay and then
go with go with that feeling that's
exactly what I did and I couldn't have
been happier with my choices the main
reason why i chose the ashrams I
stayed in was because I felt really good
when I stepped into those ashrams and
we're talking to the teachers and seeing
the students and I just felt like that
was the place for me don't go yet the
roaming gnomes is don't forget to click
